result.execSummary:
The defendant David N Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs paid in full from bond posted.

records.addlTxt: David N. Jones agrees to receive text messages for court related messages.

Defendant David N Jones in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated he will represent himself. Court recess for defendant to complete form waiving attorney. Case recalled. Court accepts defendant's waiver of right to attorney. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court recess for defendant to complete plea questionnaire.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant David N Jones by video from Ozaukee County Jail with attorney Rachel Marie Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel has received copy of complaint and waives reading.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender.  State recommends $500 cash bond.  Court sets bail.  The defendant states he will be representing herself.  Court advises defendant to have pretrial conference with the DAs office before next hearing.  Judge Williams did not take waiver during hearing but walked Waiver of Right to Attorney form to the jail before defendant's release.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 11, 2018 at 08:45 am.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
